description: College-level macroeconomics course covering national income accounting, aggregate demand and supply, fiscal and monetary policy, international trade, growth, and development. Designed to prepare students for the AP Macroeconomics exam and higher-level economics study.

topics.name: Unit 1: Foundations of Macroeconomics
topics.description: Basic macroeconomic principles, scarcity, opportunity cost, economic models, circular flow overview, and major macroeconomic indicators.

topics.name: Unit 2: Measuring Economic Performance
topics.description: GDP and components, nominal vs real measures, price indices, inflation measurement, unemployment metrics, and limitations of macroeconomic statistics.

topics.name: Unit 3: Aggregate Demand and Supply
topics.description: AD/AS model, short-run vs long-run supply, macroeconomic equilibrium, shifts in curves, and output-price dynamics.

topics.name: Unit 4: Introduction to Macro Policy
topics.description: Overview of fiscal and monetary policy tools, automatic stabilizers, policy objectives, and short-run vs long-run policy effects.

topics.name: Unit 5: Fiscal Policy In-Depth
topics.description: Government spending and taxation, multipliers, crowding out, budget deficits and debt, fiscal stimulus design, and supply-side fiscal effects.

topics.name: Unit 6: Money, Banking, Financial Systems
topics.description: Money definitions and functions, banking system structure, money creation, central bank roles, financial intermediation, and payment systems.

topics.name: Unit 7: Monetary Policy In-Depth
topics.description: Central bank policy tools, open market operations, interest rate targeting, monetary transmission mechanisms, and inflation targeting strategies.

topics.name: Unit 8: Phillips Curve & Stabilization
topics.description: Inflation–unemployment tradeoffs, short-run and long-run Phillips curve analysis, expectations, stagflation, and stabilization policy challenges.

topics.name: Unit 9: Midterm Review
topics.description: Comprehensive consolidation of Units 1–8, mixed-problem practice, data interpretation, and exam-style review.

topics.name: Unit 10: International Trade
topics.description: Comparative advantage, gains from trade, trade barriers, tariffs and quotas, and the macroeconomic impact of trade flows.

topics.name: Unit 11: Exchange Rates & Forex
topics.description: Exchange rate determination, fixed vs flexible regimes, balance of payments, currency markets, and effects of exchange-rate movements on macro variables.

topics.name: Unit 12: Economic Growth & Productivity
topics.description: Long-run growth models, productivity drivers, capital accumulation, diminishing returns, technological progress, and policy for sustainable growth.

topics.name: Unit 13: Development & Global Economics
topics.description: Development indicators, poverty traps, international institutions, foreign aid, policy for development, and global inequality dynamics.
